article.headline: Texas A&M 84, Baylor 76
article.story: WACO, Texas (AP) -- If the turnaround at Texas A&M isn't already official, it's awful close. One year after the Aggies went 0-16 in the Big 12, Texas A&M finished the regular season 8-8 in conference play Saturday with an 84-76 win over Baylor. The victory also gave the Aggies 12 more wins than last season, making them the nation's most improved team in Division I. "I'm surprised," Texas A&M head coach Billy Gillispie said. "I think everybody's surprised. I'm a big believer if you play hard and play smart and play together, anything can be accomplished." Texas A&M's eight-win improvement in the Big 12 is the biggest swing in the conference since 2000, when Iowa State went from 6-10 to 14-2. Bobby Leach scored a career-high 25 points for Texas A&M (19-8, 8-8 Big 12). Antoine Wright added 16 points and Acie Law had 15 as the Aggies won their first game in six visits to the Ferrell Center. "Bobby's been great for us all year," Gillispie said. "We think he's one of the better six guys in the league." Leach's 3-pointer put A&M ahead 53-42 with just over 13 minutes remaining. The Aggies scored only one field goal in the game's final four minutes but connected on 15-of-18 free throws to clinch the win. Baylor (9-18, 1-15) never got closer than nine points on several occasions, the last coming at 73-64 with 2:08 left to play. Baylor's (9-18, 1-15) Aaron Bruce lead all scorers with 28 points, while Tommy Swanson contributed 17 points for the Bears. "We scored enough points to win the game and rebounded well enough to win the game," Baylor coach Scott Drew said. "But they made the shots, and that's what you have to do on the road to win." Baylor led 14-7 early in the first half, but the Aggies erupted for a 13-0 run to move in front 20-14. Texas A&M led 38-29 at the half with Wright and Leach pacing the way with 10 points each.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
